00056 using System;
00057 using MathNet.Numerics.Properties;
00058 
00059 namespace MathNet.Numerics.RandomSources
00060 {
00071     public class AdditiveLaggedFibonacciRandomSource :
00072         RandomSource
00073     {
00078         const double IntToDoubleMultiplier = 1.0 / ((double)int.MaxValue + 1.0);
00079 
00084         const double UIntToDoubleMultiplier = 1.0 / ((double)uint.MaxValue + 1.0);
00085 
00089         int _shortLag;
00090 
00094         int _longLag;
00095 
00099         uint[] _x;
00100 
00104         int _i;
00105 
00109         uint _seed;
00110 
00114         uint _bitBuffer;
00115 
00119         int _bitCount;
00120 
00121 
00126         public
00127         AdditiveLaggedFibonacciRandomSource()
00128             : this((uint)Math.Abs(Environment.TickCount))
00129         {
00130         }
00131 
00139         public
00140         AdditiveLaggedFibonacciRandomSource(
00141             int seed
00142             )
00143             : this((uint)Math.Abs(seed))
00144         {
00145         }
00146 
00153         [CLSCompliant(false)]
00154         public
00155         AdditiveLaggedFibonacciRandomSource(
00156             uint seed
00157             )
00158         {
00159             _seed = seed;
00160             _shortLag = 418;
00161             _longLag = 1279;
00162             ResetGenerator();
00163         }
00164 
00172         public
00173         bool
00174         IsValidShortLag(
00175             int value
00176             )
00177         {
00178             return value > 0;
00179         }
00180 
00188         public
00189         bool
00190         IsValidLongLag(
00191             int value
00192             )
00193         {
00194             return value > _shortLag;
00195         }
00196 
00201         void
00202         ResetGenerator()
00203         {
00204             MersenneTwisterRandomSource gen = new MersenneTwisterRandomSource(_seed);
00205             
00206             _x = new uint[_longLag];
00207             for(uint j = 0; j < _longLag; ++j)
00208             {
00209                 _x[j] = gen.NextUInt();
00210             }
00211 
00212             _i = _longLag;
00213 
00214             // Reset helper variables used for generation of random bools.
00215             _bitBuffer = 0;
00216             _bitCount = 0;
00217         }
00218 
00226         void
00227         Fill()
00228         {
00229             // two loops to avoid costly modulo operations
00230             for(int j = 0; j < _shortLag; ++j)
00231             {
00232                 _x[j] = _x[j] + _x[j + (_longLag - _shortLag)];
00233             }
00234 
00235             for(int j = _shortLag; j < _longLag; ++j)
00236             {
00237                 _x[j] = _x[j] + _x[j - _shortLag];
00238             }
00239 
00240             _i = 0;
00241         }
00242 
00250         [CLSCompliant(false)]
00251         public
00252         uint
00253         NextUInt()
00254         {
00255             if(_i >= _longLag)
00256             {
00257                 Fill();
00258             }
00259 
00260             return _x[_i++];
00261         }
00262 
00270         public
00271         int
00272         NextInclusiveMaxValue()
00273         {
00274             // Its faster to explicitly calculate the unsigned random number than simply call NextUInt().
00275             if(_i >= _longLag)
00276             {
00277                 Fill();
00278             }
00279 
00280             uint x = _x[_i++];
00281             return (int)(x >> 1);
00282         }
00283 
00291         public override
00292         int
00293         Next()
00294         {
00295             // Its faster to explicitly calculate the unsigned random number than simply call NextUInt().
00296             if(_i >= _longLag)
00297             {
00298                 Fill();
00299             }
00300 
00301             uint x = _x[_i++];
00302             int result = (int)(x >> 1);
00303 
00304             // Exclude Int32.MaxValue from the range of return values.
00305             if(result == Int32.MaxValue)
00306             {
00307                 return Next();
00308             }
00309 
00310             return result;
00311         }
00312 
00327         public override
00328         int
00329         Next(
00330             int maxValue
00331             )
00332         {
00333             if(maxValue < 0)
00334             {
00335                 string message = string.Format(null, Resources.ArgumentOutOfRangeGreaterEqual, "maxValue", "0");
00336                 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException("maxValue", maxValue, message);
00337             }
00338 
00339             // Its faster to explicitly calculate the unsigned random number than simply call NextUInt().
00340             if(_i >= _longLag)
00341             {
00342                 Fill();
00343             }
00344 
00345             uint x = _x[_i++];
00346 
00347             // The shift operation and extra int cast before the first multiplication give better performance.
00348             // See comment in NextDouble().
00349             return (int)((double)(int)(x >> 1) * IntToDoubleMultiplier * (double)maxValue);
00350         }
00351 
00371         public override
00372         int
00373         Next(
00374             int minValue,
00375             int maxValue
00376             )
00377         {
00378             if(minValue > maxValue)
00379             {
00380                 string message = string.Format(null, Resources.ArgumentOutOfRangeGreaterEqual, "maxValue", "minValue");
00381                 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException("maxValue", maxValue, message);
00382             }
00383 
00384             // Its faster to explicitly calculate the unsigned random number than simply call NextUInt().
00385             if(_i >= _longLag)
00386             {
00387                 Fill();
00388             }
00389 
00390             uint x = _x[_i++];
00391 
00392             int range = maxValue - minValue;
00393             if(range < 0)
00394             {
00395                 // The range is greater than Int32.MaxValue, so we have to use slower floating point arithmetic.
00396                 // Also all 32 random bits (uint) have to be used which again is slower (See comment in NextDouble()).
00397                 return minValue + (int)
00398                     ((double)x * UIntToDoubleMultiplier * ((double)maxValue - (double)minValue));
00399             }
00400             else
00401             {
00402                 // 31 random bits (int) will suffice which allows us to shift and cast to an int before the first multiplication and gain better performance.
00403                 // See comment in NextDouble().
00404                 return minValue + (int)
00405                     ((double)(int)(x >> 1) * IntToDoubleMultiplier * (double)range);
00406             }
00407         }
00408 
00416         public override
00417         double
00418         NextDouble()
00419         {
00420             // Its faster to explicitly calculate the unsigned random number than simply call NextUInt().
00421             if(_i >= _longLag)
00422             {
00423                 Fill();
00424             }
00425 
00426             uint x = _x[_i++];
00427 
00428             // Here a ~2x speed improvement is gained by computing a value that can be cast to an int 
00429             //   before casting to a double to perform the multiplication.
00430             // Casting a double from an int is a lot faster than from an uint and the extra shift operation 
00431             //   and cast to an int are very fast (the allocated bits remain the same), so overall there's 
00432             //   a significant performance improvement.
00433             return (double)(int)(x >> 1) * IntToDoubleMultiplier;
00434         }
00435 
00450         public override
00451         double
00452         NextDouble(
00453             double maxValue
00454             )
00455         {
00456             if(maxValue < 0.0)
00457             {
00458                 string message = string.Format(null, Resources.ArgumentOutOfRangeGreaterEqual, "maxValue", "0.0");
00459                 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException("maxValue", maxValue, message);
00460             }
00461 
00462             // Its faster to explicitly calculate the unsigned random number than simply call NextUInt().
00463             if(_i >= _longLag)
00464             {
00465                 Fill();
00466             }
00467 
00468             uint x = _x[_i++];
00469 
00470             // The shift operation and extra int cast before the first multiplication give better performance.
00471             // See comment in NextDouble().
00472             return (double)(int)(x >> 1) * IntToDoubleMultiplier * maxValue;
00473         }
00474 
00502         public override
00503         double
00504         NextDouble(
00505             double minValue,
00506             double maxValue
00507             )
00508         {
00509             if(minValue > maxValue)
00510             {
00511                 string message = string.Format(
00512                     Resources.ArgumentOutOfRangeGreaterEqual,
00513                     "maxValue",
00514                     "minValue"
00515                     );
00516 
00517                 throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException("maxValue", maxValue, message);
00518             }
00519 
00520             double range = maxValue - minValue;
00521 
00522             if(range == double.PositiveInfinity)
00523             {
00524                 string message = string.Format(
00525                     Resources.ArgumentRangeLessEqual,
00526                     "minValue",
00527                     "maxValue",
00528                     "Double.MaxValue"
00529                     );
00530 
00531                 throw new ArgumentException(message);
00532             }
00533 
00534             // Its faster to explicitly calculate the unsigned random number than simply call NextUInt().
00535             if(_i >= _longLag)
00536             {
00537                 Fill();
00538             }
00539 
00540             uint x = _x[_i++];
00541 
00542             // The shift operation and extra int cast before the first multiplication give better performance.
00543             // See comment in NextDouble().
00544             return minValue + (double)(int)(x >> 1) * IntToDoubleMultiplier * range;
00545         }
00546 
00556         public override
00557         bool
00558         NextBoolean()
00559         {
00560             if(_bitCount == 0)
00561             {
00562                 // Generate 32 more bits (1 uint) and store it for future calls.
00563                 // Its faster to explicitly calculate the unsigned random number than simply call NextUInt().
00564                 if(_i >= _longLag)
00565                 {
00566                     Fill();
00567                 }
00568 
00569                 _bitBuffer = _x[_i++];
00570 
00571                 // Reset the bitCount and use rightmost bit of buffer to generate random bool.
00572                 _bitCount = 31;
00573                 return (_bitBuffer & 0x1) == 1;
00574             }
00575 
00576             // Decrease the bitCount and use rightmost bit of shifted buffer to generate random bool.
00577             _bitCount--;
00578             return ((_bitBuffer >>= 1) & 0x1) == 1;
00579         }
00580 
00592         public override
00593         void
00594         NextBytes(
00595             byte[] buffer
00596             )
00597         {
00598             if(buffer == null)
00599             {
00600                 string message = string.Format(
00601                     Resources.ArgumentNull,
00602                     "buffer"
00603                     );
00604 
00605                 throw new ArgumentNullException("buffer", message);
00606             }
00607 
00608             // Fill the buffer with 4 bytes (1 uint) at a time.
00609             int i = 0;
00610             uint w;
00611             while(i < buffer.Length - 3)
00612             {
00613                 // Its faster to explicitly calculate the unsigned random number than simply call NextUInt().
00614                 if(_i >= _longLag)
00615                 {
00616                     Fill();
00617                 }
00618 
00619                 w = _x[_i++];
00620 
00621                 buffer[i++] = (byte)w;
00622                 buffer[i++] = (byte)(w >> 8);
00623                 buffer[i++] = (byte)(w >> 16);
00624                 buffer[i++] = (byte)(w >> 24);
00625             }
00626 
00627             // Fill up any remaining bytes in the buffer.
00628             if(i < buffer.Length)
00629             {
00630                 // Its faster to explicitly calculate the unsigned random number than simply call NextUInt().
00631                 if(_i >= _longLag)
00632                 {
00633                     Fill();
00634                 }
00635 
00636                 w = _x[_i++];
00637 
00638                 buffer[i++] = (byte)w;
00639                 if(i < buffer.Length)
00640                 {
00641                     buffer[i++] = (byte)(w >> 8);
00642                     if(i < buffer.Length)
00643                     {
00644                         buffer[i++] = (byte)(w >> 16);
00645                         if(i < buffer.Length)
00646                         {
00647                             buffer[i] = (byte)(w >> 24);
00648                         }
00649                     }
00650                 }
00651             }
00652         }
00653 
00658         public override
00659         void
00660         Reset()
00661         {
00662             ResetGenerator();
00663         }
00664 
00669         public override bool CanReset
00670         {
00671             get { return true; }
00672         }
00673 
00678         public int ShortLag
00679         {
00680             get
00681             {
00682                 return _shortLag;
00683             }
00684 
00685             set
00686             {
00687                 if(this.IsValidShortLag(value))
00688                 {
00689                     _shortLag = value;
00690                 }
00691             }
00692         }
00693 
00698         public int LongLag
00699         {
00700             get
00701             {
00702                 return _longLag;
00703             }
00704 
00705             set
00706             {
00707                 if(this.IsValidLongLag(value))
00708                 {
00709                     _longLag = value;
00710                     this.Reset();
00711                 }
00712             }
00713         }
00714     }
